SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.sd.util
Class PropertiesParser

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.util.PropertiesParser

public class PropertiesParser
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to parse and load properties.

Given command line arguments, extract those that identify properties. Load and provide access to the properties and the remaining args.

Arguments that will be extracted are as follows:

  • Each argument that ends with ".default.properties" will be loaded from either the default property path (/home/$USER/cluster/properties/X.properties) or from the specified path (/.../X.properties). These will be the default or fallback properties if not overridden.
  • Each argument that ends with ".properties" will be loaded from the file specified in that argument.
  • Each argument of the form "X=Y" will be set as a property that overrides the file and default properties.

Author:
Spence Koehler

                                                 throws java.io.IOException
Load as properties all resources with the given name.

Parameters:
properties - The properties in which to load the found resources (ok if null).
name - The name of the properties resource to load.
verbose - When true, show resources from which properties resources are loaded.
Returns:
the loaded properties (== properties if non-null).
Throws:
java.io.IOException

setContext

public void setContext(java.lang.String context)
Set the current context under which properties should be retrieved.

This affects subsequent getProperty calls such that getProperty(x) will result in retrieving the "context.x" property.

getContext

public java.lang.String getContext()
Get the current context.

clearContext

public void clearContext()
Clear the current context.

getProperties

public java.lang.String[] getProperties(java.lang.String propertyName)
Get the property values (under the currently set context) of the form property_X, (alphabetically) sorted by X.

Note that if numbers are used for X they should be prepended with zero's as needed to ensure a proper alphabetical sort.

getProperties

public java.lang.String[] getProperties(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                        java.lang.String context)
Get the property under the given context.

Note that this retrieves the "context.property" property if context is non-null.

Note that if numbers are used for X they should be prepended with zero's as needed to ensure a proper alphabetical sort.

Returns:
the non-empty found properties or null if none were found.

findProperties

public java.util.List<PropertiesParser.Pair> findProperties(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                            java.lang.String context)
Get the property key/value pairs under the given context.

Note that this retrieves the "context.property" property if context is non-null.

Note that if numbers are used for X they should be prepended with zero's as needed to ensure a proper alphabetical sort.

Returns:
the non-empty found properties or null if none were found.

getMultiValues

public static final java.lang.String[] getMultiValues(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                      java.lang.String propertyPrefix)
Get all values for properties with the given prefix in sorted order.

This is intended for getting values for multiple ordered properties of the form:

propertyName_1=value1

propertyName_2=value2

and so on.

Note that _1, _2, can be _A, _B, or full word strings and their values will be collected in alphabetical order.

Parameters:
properties - The properties from which to retrieve the values.
propertyPrefix - The property name (before the ordering '_').

getMultiValues

public static final java.lang.String[] getMultiValues(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                      java.lang.String prefix,
                                                      java.lang.String propertyPrefix)
Get all values for properties with the given prefix in sorted order.

This is intended for getting values for multiple ordered properties of the form:

propertyName_1=value1

propertyName_2=value2

and so on.

Note that _1, _2, can be _A, _B, or full word strings and their values will be collected in alphabetical order.

Parameters:
properties - The properties from which to retrieve the values.
prefix - The prefix for the property (name) for generating property names of the form "prefix.property".
propertyPrefix - The property name (before the ordering '_').

getMultiValues

public static final java.lang.String[] getMultiValues(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                      java.lang.String prefix,
                                                      java.lang.String propertyPrefix,
                                                      java.lang.String[] defaultValues)
Get all values for properties with the given prefix in sorted order.

This is intended for getting values for multiple ordered properties of the form:

propertyName_1=value1

propertyName_2=value2

and so on.

Note that _1, _2, can be _A, _B, or full word strings and their values will be collected in alphabetical order.

Parameters:
properties - The properties from which to retrieve the values.
prefix - The prefix for the property (name) for generating property names of the form "prefix.property".
propertyPrefix - The property name (before the ordering '_').
defaultValues - The default values to apply when a value is not found. Note that if the defaultValue size is less than the found value size, then the last defaultValue will be used (even if null).

public static final java.lang.String findProperty(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                  java.lang.String[] names)
Find the name of the first existing property from names.

Returns:
the found property name or null.

Concatenate the prefix to the property with an intermediate '.', if non-null.

Parameters:
prefix - The prefix to the result (ok if null)
property - The property.
Returns:
"prefix.property" or "property"

getProperty

public static final java.lang.String getProperty(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                 java.lang.String prefix,
                                                 java.lang.String property,
                                                 java.lang.String defaultValue)
Get the value for the concatenated property from the properties, applying the prefix as "prefix.property".

Parameters:
properties - The properties from which to retrieve a value.
prefix - The prefix for the property (name).
property - The property (name).
defaultValue - The default value to retrieve if no value for the property (or its fallback if applied) is set.
Returns:
the value for the property (possibly null).

getProperty

public static final java.lang.String getProperty(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                 java.lang.String prefix,
                                                 java.lang.String property,
                                                 java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                                 boolean fallback)
Get the value for the concatenated property from the properties, applying the prefix as "prefix.property".

Parameters:
properties - The properties from which to retrieve a value.
prefix - The prefix for the property (name).
property - The property (name).
defaultValue - The default value to retrieve if no value for the property (or its fallback if applied) is set.
fallback - If true, then return the value associated with "property" iff the value for "prefix.property" is null.
Returns:
the value for the property (possibly null).

getMissingProperties

public static final java.lang.String getMissingProperties(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                          java.lang.String[] names)
Get the names of properties that are missing.

Returns:
null if non are missing; otherwise, return the names of the missing properties in a comma delimited string.

getMissingProperties

public static final java.lang.String getMissingProperties(java.util.Properties properties,
                                                          java.lang.String[][] alternateNameSets)
Get the name of properties that are missing from one of the sets.

It is assumed that the sets are mutually exclusive and that when one property is present for a set, all properties must be present for that set and no properties are present for any other set.

If no property is found, create a string representing all of the sets separated by " or " as a delimiter.

Returns:
null if one set of properties is fully present; otherwise a string representing the missing properties.

                       throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException
